Issues.Title: DataGridView throws NRE when Narrator is active
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4228

## Proposed changes
- Added skipped checks for null. The issue is reproduced because in some cases the "DataGridView" property may be null. Most of the methods and properties check that the "DataGridView" property is not null. But in some places (including the "FragmentRoot" property) we forgot to add this check and got an exception as a result.
- Added unit tests. 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

Issues.Title: Enable selected Roslyn analyzers and auto fix ups
Issues.Body:
❗ DO NOT SQUASH!

During reviews we appears to be spending time on benign issues like spacing or correct brace position. Enforce such things via Roslyn Analyzers.

* Enable SA1513: a closing brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is not followed by a blank line
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/111419585-d9b1e000-873d-11eb-8b69-e5da9e964eab.png)

* Enable SA1500: The opening or closing brace within a C# statement, element, or expression is not placed on its own line (a bit of manual reformatting involved)

❗  These rule are set to "error" to break builds in VS, as "warning" isn't triggering VS but will fail cli builds.


The clean up was done by running [`dotnet-fromat` tool](https://github.com/dotnet/format): `dotnet-format --fix-analyzers warn` (the 6 hours of my life I will never get back).

Issues.Title: ListViewSubItems in the ListView have incorrect behavior
Issues.Body:
## Details
### Case 1 (regression from #3223):
- [ ] A yellow rectangle is drawn for the entire `ListViewItem` instead of the selected `ListViewSubItem`

**Actual behavior:**
![Issue-4690-details-case1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111447695-ba578a80-871e-11eb-9dc4-39aa45238af1.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111448495-85980300-871f-11eb-9346-6d23b052b604.png)

### Case 2:
- [ ] The image does not have its accessibility object in the `ListView`

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111451977-0f959b00-8723-11eb-8225-6a1551022007.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111452076-2cca6980-8723-11eb-837f-8b548e2bfa51.png)

### Case 3:
- [ ] ListViewSubItem of an ListViewItem are not displayed in the Inspector tree when the ListViewItem is in a ListViewGroup (may be fixed in #4678)

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111466674-a4ed5b00-8734-11eb-8ff2-d8dd253a49ed.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111466706-acacff80-8734-11eb-9f97-63d990548f91.png)

## Tile
### Case 1 (regression from #3223):
 - [ ] `ListViewSubItem` of an `ListViewItem` are not displayed in the Inspector tree when the `ListViewItem` is in a `ListViewGroup` (#4678)

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111444647-a4949600-871b-11eb-8381-817028884fa8.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111444728-bb3aed00-871b-11eb-8420-1f630c8f9468.png)

### Case 2 (regression from #3223):
 - [ ] The rectangle is not displayed for a `ListViewSubItem` when the user hovers over it or selects in the Inspector tree (#4679)

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111445629-a4e16100-871c-11eb-80fa-2e0502ad807f.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111445672-b1fe5000-871c-11eb-85a7-163805e7ad14.png)

## List
### Case 1:
- [ ] `ListViewSubItem` in a `ListView` do not have accessibility objects

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111455530-f7277f80-8726-11eb-93e7-58f8567ae2a9.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111455558-00185100-8727-11eb-8ca0-efc2831d156c.png)

## LargeIcon
### Case 1:
- [ ] `ListViewSubItem` in a `ListView` do not have accessibility objects

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111459193-6d2de580-872b-11eb-8b34-c26e8d6e9363.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111459197-71f29980-872b-11eb-8051-675e8a0f7ff4.png)

## SmallIcon
### Case 1:
- [ ] `ListViewSubItem` in a `ListView` do not have accessibility objects

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111458355-62268580-872a-11eb-8fb6-3c3ea56a2de9.png)

**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111458398-6c488400-872a-11eb-9211-83c4029e33bc.png)

## Common:
### Case 1:
- [ ] The checkbox does not have its accessibility object in the `ListView`

**Actual behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/111449792-c7757900-8720-11eb-914f-fd02d6b349ab.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The checkbox should have its accessibility object in the `ListView`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListViewSubItems in the ListView have incorrect behavior" (#4690)

Issues.Title: Clean up interactive dialog test
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
/ **Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**

During PR #4645 discussion it was noted that interactive testing of various combinations of dialog options would be easier to do by making a property grid available to configure the dialogs instead of having just a small number of predefined test scenarios to chose from.

This issue is a follow-up to that PR to clean up existing predefined scenarios and integrate them into the more general property grid based approach.

Also consider adding support for predefined scenarios to the property grid approach (maybe through a context menu or as another toolbar button on the property grid).

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**

No, just affects the interactive test project
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clean up interactive dialog test" (#4687)

Issues.Title: Fix inversion of conditional
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Contributes to #4370

## Proposed changes

This regression to Desktop Framework was found while investigating #4370. It is unclear what the effects of this regression are, but [comparing](https://referencesource.microsoft.com/#System.Windows.Forms/winforms/Managed/System/WinForms/Control.cs,15700) with Desktop Framework it seems its a mistake from refactoring

When running a debug build of WinForms during investigation of #4370 I had turned on `CompModSwitches.ActiveX` and the broken code resulted in warnings of the ActiveX host passing wrong flags (which of course is wrong, using MFC or Office as host you can assume they pass the right flags).

## Customer Impact

- unknown, probably changing behavior of hosted controls due to wrong flags being passed to host

## Regression? 

- yes

## Risk

- low, restoring code to how it was before. There was another recent regression fix for #4370 so this should be fine to accompany the other fix

### Before

- running the sample from #4370 (or generally, hosting a WinForms control in a MFC app or other ActiveX host) outputs warnings when using a WinForms debug build with ActiveX tracing turned on

### After

- no warnings in debug build

## Test methodology

- source inspection
- running the sample from #4370 with a debug build of WinForms, making sure the previously observed warning is gone

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- MFC application (stock app from wizard) initializing the WinForms control from the sample code
- Outlook 16.0.13801.20240 (32 bit) hosting the WinForms control from the sample code

Issues.Title: The yellow rectangle is not displayed for a subitem when the user hovers over it or selects in the Inspector tree
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version:
- 5.0.200-preview.20614.14

Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
- No. It is regression from #3223

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create application with ListView.
2. Set View.Tile for ListView
3. Add couple ColumnHeaders to ListView.
4. Add ListViewItem with ListViewSubItem to ListView.
5. Or use [attached project](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/6130220/Issue-4679.zip)
6. Run application.
7. Run Inpsector.
8. Select ListViewItem in Inspector.
9. Expand ListViewItem
10. Select ListViewSubItem.

**Actual behavior:**
Yellow rectangle is not displayed.
![Issue-4678-issue2 - actual ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/110942414-d6d47b00-834a-11eb-8c37-f5758a16f651.png)

**Expected:**
Yellow rectangle should displaye around the ListViewSubItem
![Issue-4678-issue2 - expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/110942444-df2cb600-834a-11eb-9b89-301919189116.png)

**Note:**
I think the problem is reproduced due to [this condition](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/775aef04bf1f5d2c8af3ff01c622749438bc464f/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ListView.cs#L3656). `View.Tile` view also supports displaying the first subitem
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The yellow rectangle is not displayed for a subitem when the user hovers over it or selects in the Inspector tree" (#4679)

Issues.Title: `ListViewSubItem` not shown in Inspector tree when `ListViewItem` belongs to group
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version:
- 5.0.200-preview.20614.14

Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
- No. It is regression from #3223

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create application with ListView.
2. Set View.Tile for ListView.
3. Add couple ColumnHeaders to ListView.
4. Add ListViewGroup to ListView.
5. Add ListViewItem with ListViewSubItem to ListView.
6. Select ListViewGroup as Group of the ListViewItem.
7. Or use [attached project](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/6130214/Issue-4678.zip)
8. Run application.
9. Run Inpsector.
10. Select ListViewItem in Inspector.
11. Try to expand ListViewItem

**Actual behavior:**
ListViewItem is empty.
![Issue-4678-issue - actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/110942192-865d1d80-834a-11eb-80a1-a499931046a1.png)

**Expected behavior:**
ListViewItem should contains ListViewSubItem
![Issue-4678-issue - expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/110942221-91b04900-834a-11eb-9c04-2a583547a6a3.png)

**Note**
I think this problem is produced due to strange checking of the `_owningGroup` in [this condition](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/2178e7a66ed27332202659c3ea86649dc4578c3d/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ListViewItem.ListViewItemAccessibleObject.cs#L150)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`ListViewSubItem` not shown in Inspector tree when `ListViewItem` belongs to group" (#4678)
